ComicInfo.Title: If I Were a King; Our Lovely Home; My Troubles With Women - Part II; My Troubles with Women; Footsy; Uncle Bob's Mid-Life Crisis; Memories Are Made of This; Arline 'n' Bob and That Thing In the Bedroom; I'm Grateful! I'm Grateful!
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with the ninjas.walk.alone fork of ComicTagger 1.3.5 using info from Comic Vine on 2024-05-19 15:21:57. [CVDB372846] Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-16 17:06:02. [Issue ID 793854]

ComicInfo.Summary:
R. Crumb imagines that he was a king. Anyone familiar with his comics knows what happens then.
Aline admires her newly slim body and criticizes Robert's flabby stomach. Robert ponders how explicit this comic should be. The couple goes out in the yard to cut the weeds.
The couple oversee the improvements workers are making to their house.
Crumb goes more in-depth into his psyche with this follow-up story, this time attempting to bring out the root causes of his deviant behavior.
A "true confession" as Crumb talks about his checkered history with women, from early childhood to his jaded post-sixties flings.
Crumb details his lifelong obsession with playing footsy.
Crumb struggles with his mid-life crisis.
Crumb recalls the time he visited a woman he didn't like just to see if he could get sex from her.
The couple spend a day in the city and struggle with the responsibilities of parenthood.
Crumb elucidates the many things he's grateful for in his life.
